author: Staff Reporter
text:
Marumalarchi Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam recently launched a campaign at Kovaipudur and nearby areas to revive water bodies. The partly expressed the need for reviving water bodies and removing encroachments from water bodies, forest areas and the elephant corridor, resulting in increasing human-animal conflicts.

During the campaign, the MDMK said it was batting for the Makkal Nala Kootani and would vote for that alliance alone as it would facilitate revival of water bodies in the city and remove encroachments from the forest areas.

MDMK State Youth Wing secretary V. Eswaran, who heads the awareness campaign, claimed that widespread encroachments permitted by the Dravida Munetra Kazhagam and the All India Anna Dravida Munetra Kazhagam as reason for the recent disastrous flooding in Chennai.

He said that the encroachment of River Noyyal, besides Kurichi and Vellalore Tanks would lead to a similar disaster in Coimbatore, but the present government was not concerned about reviving the water bodies. He added that the drying up of rivers and streams was due to encroachments.
title: MDMK launches campaign to revive water bodies
